headline: Low-Carb Salisbury Steak
description: Homemade mushroom gravy takes the flavor of simple hamburger steaks to the next level. It's still quick enough to cook for a weeknight dinner.
name: Low-Carb Salisbury Steak
recipeIngredient: 2 cups sliced button mushrooms, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Mix ground beef, onion, eggs, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, parsley, 2 teaspoons salt, garlic powder, onion powder, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper together in a bowl. Split steak mixture into 6 portions and form into patties.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties, 3 at a time, until slightly browned on one side, about 5 minutes. Flip and cook until other side is browned, about 5 minutes more. Repeat with remaining patties, pouring off any excess liquid. Place Salisbury steaks on a plate and cover with aluminum foil to maintain heat.
Melt butter in the same skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Transfer mushrooms to a bowl, reserving butter in the skillet.

Stir flour into the butter until dissolved. Pour in beef broth slowly, stirring until thickened, about 7 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce; cook, stirring frequently, until gravy starts to thicken slightly, about 5 minutes. Add sour cream and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring until all sour cream is melted and gravy is light brown, about 2 minutes.
Stir mushrooms back into the gravy. Remove from heat and let cool until thickened, about 2 minutes. Ladle gravy and mushrooms over steak patties.

review.reviewBody: I loved this dish!! I used xanthan gum as a thickener instead of flour. I will be making this again!
This recipe was delicious. It pleased the entire family. I followed it as is and was very pleased.
need to have a mushroom gravy without the flour...
I love this! I have made it several times. I didn't change a thing, followed the recipe everytime. Delicious!
Tried this for dinner last night and my husband loved it! I will definitely make this again.
Was very good, I added crispy fried onions on top. My husband enjoyed that
This is not low carb at all by the time I pour it on my mashed taters (or rice). Yum!

Kudos Chef DJ! Fantastic recipe! My wife purchased really lean hamburger, so I added a little olive oil to help the patties brown better. As a member of savory spice, I also added some hickory rock and maple pepper seasoning to the patties as they cooked. Best Salisbury steak/mushroom gravy recipe I’ve ever eaten!! I saved a portion for my elderly neighbor and she told me I can make this recipe how often as I want!

Low carb is just what I was looking for. I need to eat low saturated fat as well, so I mixed ground turkey with the beef. It formed perfectly, and was so flavorful. I drained the pan well and added 1 Tbsp butter and 1 Tbsp smart balance for the gravy. I added a little sour cream, but wish I hadn't as the flavor was more like stroganoff (pretty good tho!) I froze some and that will make a simple future dinner. I love when people build on recipes in reviews because it gives me a lot of ideas.
Turned out great. Great taste and gravy was delicious. We used chunks of mushrooms
Delicious!
Next time I'll add a little more flour to the gravy. As instructed the gravy was a little thin.
This is great food for the soul. Really great recipe. This is a picture of what’s left.

My husband and love this recipe. I made as it was written. We eat it with mashed potatoes and steamed meal. We love mushrooms so I do add some extra. The one other change I would make is less salt in the patties. 1 tsp is plenty.
Will make again! Delicious! I doubled the amount of Worcestershire in the sauce as the sour cream over powered it just a tad.

Loved this! I have never made Salisbury Steak before, but this recipe looked really good. I made my patties a little smaller and I had no problem with them falling apart. My boys do not like crunchy onions so I sauteed them before adding to the HB Meat - other than that, made exactly to recipe and it was wonderful. Definitely a hit and I will making this again!

This was easy and tasty. I did not have the gravy, but my husband said it was great. On the gravy I used 3 tablespoons of butter instead of 7 and it was fine. Also used a 10 oz can of beef consomme instead of beef broth because that's what I had, very tasty.
Really tasty but the sodium was pretty high.

I rated this recipe the first time I made it with 4 stars, but have to say I just made it for the second time and didn't enjoy it nearly as much as the first time. I made it exactly like the first time so I don't know what was different. We try not to eat too much red meat so if I'm going to have a beef patty, I would prefer my delicious home-made burgers. My hubby agrees!!
Went over well. Definitely will double the gravy next time!
Loved it!
Loved it!
I will make it again. Very good. Only change was using corn starch in place of flour for thickening.
Great dish. Added garlic to onions and sautéed them before mixing with 1 lb hamburger with one lb ground steak. Used montreal steak seasoning in place of salt and pepper
I made it. I added extra mushrooms. I will make it again
I didn’t have sour cream, so used some Golden Mushroom Soup. Larry really liked, I thought it was a little better than ok.

Why do people whine in the comments section about people changing the recipe to their liking? People have different tastes. 
 Different strokes for different folks. Just stupid.
taste very yummy and easy to make
It turn out great. My family love it we will have it again
This was the best Salisbury steak recipe ever! I used ground turkey and it was simply delicious!
Family enjoyed.
Great recipe! Only thing I did different was to add another cup of beef broth to make more gravy. Thanks for sharing.
Sooo yummy and easy to make. We made extras for leftovers! Easy to reheat and have for lunch the next day.
Very tasty! Will definitely put this dish in the rotation. Super easy!
This has a lot of flavor! Delicious! I made it with mashed potatoes because...... well, I wanted some carbs. I also put the gravy on my potatoes. Oh my!

Great keto recipe! It just says onion, use small to medium onion because I had a large one and it was a little much to help keep the patty together. I cooked the diced onion(you could microwave or sauté)unless you like crunchy onion in your patty. Also, I like easy recipes and it says 2 cups of sliced mushrooms, instead of having to measure I just used all the 16oz size and worked perfectly. It made 6 really nice sized patties.
choice of meat is important, Caramelized onions instead of raw onions is what my family prefers.
Very tasty, have made it twice and will definitely make it often!

Added some finely chopped carrot and yellow pepper
1/3 cup bread crumbs
I did cut it in half, but don't cut the sauce in half . If you do you won't have enough. We liked the recipe as is though.
Sorry, still has the texture and consistency of ground beef .

This turned out really tasty. It took forever to make though. So many steps that took 5-10 mins each. Luckily it made a ton so we were able to eat it for a few days but I’m not sure it was worth the effort.

Followed the recipe and it came out great. The sauce was the star and could be used over any kind of beef steak and would be awesome. This sauce could easily be modified with the addition of a red wine in the cooking process.

So easy to make and tasted amazing. I
 definitely recommend this dish.
My whole family loved it! It is so simple and you would never know it was low carb.
This was very good!!!
It was delicious. My elderly dad and my husband both loved the flavorful mushroom sauce and the steak patties.
Yummy
Huge hit w my family! Including a picky 4year old!
My family loved it! My suggestion is to finely dice the onion. The mushrooms would have been better smaller as well.

YES! Will make again - Hubs loved it! The only thing I changed was I used less meat (only made 4 patties) in hopes of having more meat/sauce ratio and adjusted the meat ingredients accordingly. When I was nearing the end I still thought there was not enough sauce! So I put in some extra broth and thickened that up before serving. Just to make my Hubs a little happier - I used less onion - I have to sneak it in!
Wonderfully delicious - Satisfying comfort dish and pretty healthy made Some with hamburger and some w turkey burger - both were great!thank you

I don't care for Stroganoff so I subbed heavy cream for the sour cream and it was perfect. I am on Keto and this recipe fits it just right. Ate every bit in three meals. I live alone so I made half of it and enjoyed every bit.
No changes, will make it again. My husband really liked it, too.
Increased the broth to 2 cups and added a little extra flour because of that.
This was a great and easy to prepare recipe. My sauce was not quite thick enough so next time I will add more flour.
very good
Excellent, easy meal...served over cauliflower mashed potatoes and a salad and broccoli...yum!

Found this recipe in my email feed this morning. I have to say, I get a bit too excited when I have every ingredient listed on hand. So lunch was decided. Just before noon, I took the ground beef I had bought yesterday out of the fridge. Two and a half pounds of it. It was a lot and it’s just me. I opted to take advice from others, not by doubling the gravy, but by cutting the steak ingredients in half. I typically brown ground beef and freeze it into small portions for future recipes. I began this process while chopping the onion. The smell of frying meat led me to pour myself a glass of red wine. (Am I alone here?) I prepped the steak mixture and immediately realized I added two eggs. The horror! I have no more meat to add now! I can’t even blame it on the wine! I was already committed so I decided to make the best of it. I used my mom’s cast iron skillet (for the first time ever), thinking her cooking skills may save me. I carefully transferred the steaks to the pan. It looked like a mess. But it smelled like heaven. I managed to maintain the shape of one steak for the money shot. And then I tasted it. Holy smokes this stuff is amazing. The onions were perfectly done. Layers of flavor in every bite. Now there probably was some residue from the many bacon-greased batches of fried okra, or from the liver and onions that my older siblings were forced to eat before I came along, so don’t expect yours to be as yummy as mine. Odds are, yours is gonna look better.

I made this recipe and my family LOVED it! It was so simple and the taste was as if I'd spent hours on it! Definitely will be making this again except I'm going to have to double the recipe cause there weren't any leftovers for lunches the next day.

Best Salisbury steak I ever had. We doubled the gravy as many reviewers suggested and it was about right. Used a -ton of mushrooms because that's the best part for me. I accidentally tripled the Worchestershire in the gravy, but otherwise kept the recipe the same. Had no issues with patties coming apart.
I used onions instead of mushrooms and loved it
I made it just like the recipe called for and my son and I loved it. I will definitely make it again
I made it just like the recipe called for and my son and I loved it. I will definitely make it again
Absolutely delicious! Whole family loved it, kids grandkids and great-grandkids. New family fave. I'll take a picture next time before it's all gone.

Meat patties take longer than 5 mins on each side, so I ended up putting them in the oven on 350 degrees for 5 mins while I was preparing the sauce. Other than that, the meal was delicious. Also, used meatloaf mix instead of all beef. Wife prefers that. Turned out great!

I made this recipe exactly as instructed. Very tasty. However, there was no direction as so the size of the “diced” onion. I found the still crunchy onion in the patty a bit out of place. I think next time I will slightly sauté the onions to soften them a bit for the patties
This is delicious just as it is written.

Loved it and it was a big success with bf as well, who can be a little picky. Due to health issues made a somewhat leaner version, using lean ground beef, light margarine instead of butter and 1% sour cream. It was amazing! 
Used a bit of beef broth while cooking the meat to keep the pan from burning but otherwise followed recipe and came out perfect. I kept the meat in a 225F oven to keep it warm while I cooked the sauce. Will make it again

I made this as stated except I left out the flour for the gravy and used onion instead of mushrooms, we dont like mushrooms. Was amazing! Weve been missing gravy and this was such a nice surprise.Warning, the gravy was pretty salty so taste before adding more salt.
Ran out of onion powder, used diced onions for the meat. Added chopped onion before the mushrooms.

Delicious and easy to make. I only had 1 lb of organic, grass fed, 93% lean beef, so I cut the recipe in half. I also caramelized the onions before adding them to the meat mixture and made 6 patties, which I cooked on the grill and I made the gravy separately. I used portobello mushrooms. The meal was a big hit with my husband. Will definitely make again.

Delicious and easy to make. I only had 1 lb of organic, grass fed, 93% lean beef, so I cut the recipe in half. I also caramelized the onions before adding them to the meat mixture and made 6 patties, which I cooked on the grill and I made the gravy separately. I used portobello mushrooms. The meal was a big hit with my husband. Will definitely make again.
Not so much.

I followed the recipe as written and both my husband and I thought it was delicious. 
I only used one pound of ground beef so I halved the recipe for the meat portion, but kept the gravy the same. 
One pound of beef made 4 good size patties, so we have leftovers for another night. 
Will definitely make again

3*s for flavor (but would have been much tastier w/FRESH garlic & herbs). Yes, these are low-carb, BUT very high in calories & fat. It seems that everything is a trade-off, so "Choose Your Poison", as my dad would say.
Good stuff. Easy to make and I'll do it again.
Good stuff. Easy to make and I'll do it again.

I'm sure this would be a wonderful dish but it's not low carb with flour, you'd need to sub almond or coconut flour... Or better yet don't bother with flour, give it extra cooking time so it can reduce to thicken
Why do people make so many changes to a recipe that it is a totally different dish then post it in the comments. Just stupid.

It's so much better if you use real parsley, real crushed garlic and chopped onion instead of the stuff from your spice cabinet. With no bread crumbs to help bind it together (because it's no carb) you do have to be careful when turning the patties over. The gravy was great.
Added some heavy whipping cream into the gravy. Definitely will make again.
Very easy and delicious. I made it pretty much as directed but I added more garlic powder and salt and pepper. This would be good with noodles on the side.
tasted like hamburgers with gravy
I made this last night. It was easy and delicious. The gravy reminds me of stroganoff. Will definitely be making this again!
Just loved it!

Tasted just like regular Salisbury steak! I omitted the flour and substituted gluten free Xanthan gum due to a wheat allergy. Honestly you couldn't have tasted the difference. Great served with low carb califlower mash!
Very, very good. Will be making again. Halfed the recipe with just one lb hamburger. Would make more gravy. Served with boiled potatoes. Yum!

Didn’t have beef broth so used chicken broth instead and cornstarch as a thickener for the gravy. The meat patties are nicely flavoured, I used green onions, they look nice in the patty mix. It was so good and will make it again!

My granddaughter asked me to make my Salisbury steak for her visit today. However, I knew she was on a low carb diet due the need to lose weight for her upcoming surgery. Found just what I needed. This is a great recipe. Followed the recipe for the steaks but made adjustments for the gravy. She doesn't eat mushrooms so I had to leave them out, also changed the sour cream to low fat milk (was out of sour cream) with the beef broth and an extra tablespoon of flour. Taste good!

I gave this recipe 5 stars after some changes I made. I added sage, green pepper in the patty, a clove of garlic. I skipped the eggs as I figured that would make them too fragile to turn. I did not use any kind of carb at all though. I skipped the 7 tablespoons of butter and used 1/2 of the onion soup package instead. That way I dumped a bunch of calories and it was healthier for me and my heart. You will have to figure out how much of the onion soup to use. Very tasty.

This was Great! I have never had Salisbury Steak with the sour cream, I have always made it with "regular" gravy with lots of onions (and sometimes mushrooms) in it. This is now a new thing at our house. We did use Greek yogurt being careful to just add a little at a time to the not too hot pan) instead of sour cream and low fat burger. I have no doubt that the original ingredients make it even better (including the higher fat beef the footnote mentioned) and I will try that sometime. We are just losing some of the holiday weight we put on. Thank you Chef DJ!

Very good flavor, no problem w patties falling apart as others said. Just be gentle and only flip once. I didnt have mushrooms so made onion gravy. (Did not use the butter, just sauteed onions in drippings, then sprinkled the flour over, mixed in and let cook for couple mins, then added broth and brought to boil to thicken) Only used 1/4 c sour cream, which was plenty to give creaminess and a little extra flavor. Easy to prepare, and made a good weeknight meal.
Delicious. Easy. The only change I made was to double the gravy mixture and thickened accordingly. WantedWill definitely make it again. Only one of my patties felt apart into two pieces.
Mine didn't turn out well. It came out with too strong of an onion and sour cream flavor.

Great. made 1/2 the meat exactly and 100% gravy. Perfect amount. next time will leave out the sour cream, tasted the gravy before and was GREAT, think sc just added extra calories not need. but 100% will make again.
Pretty tasty. I would double the gravy recipe because-who doesn’t love some more gravy! Will make again.
Very easy! I needed a low carb meal tonight and just didn't know what to fix. Went in search of salisbury steak (and have never made it before). So glad I found this recipe. Definitely a keeper
Yummy! Only thing is that it falls apart easily. However, I am on low carbs so no bread crumbs to make it stick. Husband approved too.
